wikipedia_page.main: Alec Ewart Glassey (29 December 1887 – 26 June 1970) was a British Liberal politician. He was Member of Parliament for East Dorset from 1929 to 1931.

response: David John Moore Cornwell was born on 19 October 1931 in Poole, Dorset, England. His father was Ronald Thomas Archibald (Ronnie) Cornwell (1905–75),GRO Register of Births: DEC 1905 5a 231 Poole - Ronald Thomas A. Cornwell and his mother was Olive Moore Cornwell (née Glassey, b. 1906). His older brother, Tony (1929–2017), was an advertising executive and county cricketer (for Dorset), who lived in the U.S. His younger half-sister was the actress Charlotte Cornwell (1949–2021), and his younger half-brother, Rupert Cornwell (1946-2017), was a former Washington bureau chief for the newspaper The Independent.  His uncle was Liberal MP Alec Glassey, who gave Cornwell his mother's Ipswich address, when he was 21 years old. Cornwell had little early memory of his mother, who had left their family home when he was five years old. They reacquainted at "Ipswich (upstation) railway platform" some 16 years later at his mother's written invitation following Cornwell's initial letter of reconciliation.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1929 United Kingdom general election

response: As a National Government, it contained members of the Conservative Party, Liberals and National Labour, as well as a number of individuals who belonged to no political party. The breakaway Liberal Nationals supported the National Government after their formation in September 1931 but none received posts in the new administration. Subsequently two Liberal ministers, Alec Glassey and John Pybus, defected to the Liberal Nationals. It did not contain members of the Labour Party as MacDonald had been expelled from it.  The Labour Party led the opposition.

List of Lords Commissioners of the Treasury

response: At the 1922 general election Hall Caine was elected Member of Parliament (MP) for East Dorset as an Independent Conservative. He took the Conservative Whip in 1923 and held the seat until the 1929 general election, when he lost to Liberal candidate Alec Glassey. In the 1931 general election he regained the East Dorset seat, this time until 1945. His brother Derwent had won Everton in 1929 as a Labour candidate, but lost it in 1931.
